intro: Scutellaria chodshakasiani, commonly known as the Kashmir scullion, is a perennial herb native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the mint family, Lamiaceae, and is characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color, which bloom during the summer months. It is often found in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
